oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - David Peterson and 1946 - 2006-05-27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by David Peterson and 1946 from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 27, 2006. In support of the exhibit Banjo Man: the Musical Journey of Earl Scruggs.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: David Peterson and 1946:
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Recording begins in progress / (00:00) Opening comments by Ali Tonn / (00:45) Introduction of moderator John Rumble / (04:01) Introduction of the band / (04:26) My Dixie Home / (06:50) True Life Blues / (10:52) David answers question from John about how he became interested in bluegrass music / (14:44) Charlie Cushman talks about his interest in banjo and Earl Scruggs and plays the difference in the playing style of Earl Scruggs and clawhammer style as played by David "Stringbean" Akeman / (18:06) Cripple Creek / (20:26) Bluegrass Breakdown / (24:10) Comments from John Rumble about the importance of instruments in bluegrass music / (26:10) Mother Prays Loud In Her Sleep / (30:30) David introduces the band / (33:35) 1946 / (36:28) John Rumble talks about songs recorded in 1946 by Lester Flatt and Earl Scruggs with they were with the Bluegrass Boys / (39:31) Heavy Traffic Ahead / (43:23) I'm Going Back To Old Kentucky / (46:55) I Hear A Sweet Voice Calling / (51:35) Molly and Tenbrooks /
(57:30) You Better Get Right Little Darling / (01:01:35) Blue Yodel #3 / (01:08:10) Rubber Dolly with voice over / Program End.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: David Peterson and 1946 (Musical group); Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
